info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 7:41PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...NORTHEASTERN GREENE AND NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EST... At 740 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fredericktown-Millsboro, or 10 miles north of Waynesburg, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Connellsville, Monessen, California, Donora, Monongahela, Charleroi, West Newton, Bentleyville, Brownsville, Fredericktown-Millsboro, South Connellsville, and Perryopolis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 53. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 17 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
